title: Calories in 2 Cups Flour
meta_description: Discover calories in 2 cups flour, including carbs, protein, fat details per 100g basis, totals, and preparation tweaks for baking.
assumptions: All-purpose white flour, unsifted (≈120 g per cup), plain without additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by flour type (e.g., all-purpose vs. whole wheat), brand, sifting, and measurement accuracy. Check packaging when available.

quick_answer.text: 2 cups all-purpose flour provide ~874 kcal and ~182 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Sifted flour (≈100 g per cup, lighter)

faqs.q: How many calories in 2 cups of all-purpose flour?
faqs.a: Approximately 874 kcal for 2 cups (240 g total).

faqs.q: What are the carbs in 2 cups flour?
faqs.a: About 182 g carbs, including 6.5 g fiber and minimal sugars.

faqs.q: Does flour have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Yes, ~24 g protein and 2.4 g fat in 2 cups, mostly from the grain.

faqs.q: How does whole wheat flour compare in calories?
faqs.a: Slightly lower at ~816 kcal for 2 cups, with more fiber (~12 g).

faqs.q: Why measure flour by weight not cups?
faqs.a: Cups vary by packing/sifting; 120 g per cup is standard for accuracy.
